summary: This bill, the North Platte Canteen Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a Congressional Gold Medal to the individuals and communities that volunteered and donated to the North Platte Canteen in Nebraska during World War II. The canteen provided food and support to approximately 6 million U.S. troops. The bill outlines the design and presentation of the medal, gives authority for duplicate bronze medals, and specifies where the medal will be displayed. This act also outlines how funds are used to pay for the medal.
